intro: Capsella bursa-pastoris grandiflora, commonly known as the greater shepherd's purse, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive triangular seed pods and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is often found in temperate climates. Its leaves are lobed and hairy, and it has a short, upright stem. The species is part of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard.
